title: Verbose `Sized` errors when `for`-looping over an error type

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
This code: ([playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=beta&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=beff6ac84372de1e4da1eecc5579ab92))

```rust
fn foo(x: &str) {}

fn misspelled() -> Vec<String> {unimplemented!()}

fn main() {
    for x in mispelled() {
        foo(&x);
    }
}
```

Would compile if the call to `misspelled` wasn't misspelled, but since it is type inference concludes that `x` is a `str` and the compiler emits *three* E0277s:

```
error[E0425]: cannot find function `mispelled` in this scope
 --> src/main.rs:6:14
  |
3 | fn misspelled() -> Vec<String> {unimplemented!()}
  | ------------------------------ similarly named function `misspelled` defined here
...
6 |     for x in mispelled() {
  |              ^^^^^^^^^ help: a function with a similar name exists: `misspelled`

error[E0277]: the size for values of type `str` cannot be known at compilation time
 --> src/main.rs:6:9
  |
6 |     for x in mispelled() {
  |         ^ doesn't have a size known at compile-time
  |
  = help: the trait `Sized` is not implemented for `str`
  = note: all local variables must have a statically known size
  = help: unsized locals are gated as an unstable feature

error[E0277]: the size for values of type `str` cannot be known at compilation time
 --> src/main.rs:6:14
  |
6 |     for x in mispelled() {
  |              ^^^^^^^^^^^ doesn't have a size known at compile-time
  |
  = help: the trait `Sized` is not implemented for `str`
  = note: all local variables must have a statically known size
  = help: unsized locals are gated as an unstable feature

error[E0277]: the size for values of type `str` cannot be known at compilation time
 --> src/main.rs:6:5
  |
6 | /     for x in mispelled() {
7 | |         foo(&x);
8 | |     }
  | |_____^ doesn't have a size known at compile-time
  |
  = help: the trait `Sized` is not implemented for `str`
  = note: required by `None`

error: aborting due to 4 previous errors
```

That last one's span puts squiggles over the whole `for` loop in an IDE, making it hard to find the actual problem.
